body: LEAD: At this moment in world history, is there anything more soul-wrenching than babies with AIDS? For them, things start bad and, one way or another, just keep getting worse. At this moment in world history, is there anything more soul-wrenching than babies with AIDS? For them, things start bad and, one way or another, just keep getting worse.
title: ABOUT NEW YORK; East Flatbush Casts Wary Eye On AIDS Babies

body: LEAD: There is a 7,000-acre miracle of nature scattered about the concrete platform that is New York City. Parceled out among the five boroughs, these enclaves of untouched wilderness are the unmanicured segments of the 26,000 acres under the domain of the Department of Parks and Recreation. There is a 7,000-acre miracle of nature scattered about
title: 7,000 Acres of Urban Wilderness

body: LEAD: Twenty thousand people live in the Marine Park section of Brooklyn, and on Sundays, after a quiet morning in church or a quick jog through the park, many head for the municipal Marine Park Golf Course. body: LEAD: FRIDAY DINOSAURS ON DISPLAY FRIDAY DINOSAURS ON DISPLAY The world's largest permanent display of brontosauruses, stegosauruses and other dinosaurs has been joined by dozens of other fossils for a historic exhibition that opens today at the American Museum of Natural History. The exhibition, ''From the Land of Dragons,'' includes 51 fossils of
title: WEEKENDER GUIDE

body: LEAD: The New York Philharmonic is to open its summer series of free outdoor concerts in public parks with a program of Schubert, Tchaikovsky and Stravinsky on Aug. 1 on the Great Lawn of Central Park. James DePreist will conduct. The same program will be repeated that week in parks in Brooklyn and Queens and on Staten Island and Long The New York
title: New York Philharmonic In Free Parks Concerts

body: LEAD: In addition to more than a dozen walking tours led by city-history buffs and nature walks conducted by the Parks Department's Urban Park Rangers, there will be a variety of other outdoor tours this weekend, ranging from a 32-mile marathon walk and a sailboat cruise of the Brooklyn waterfront to a voyage past several Hudson River lighthouses.
title: Selected Outdoor Touring by Foot, Bus and Boat
